text: Join me at the Portland Greens 2020 Grassroots Action Meeting and Caucus Saturday March 7 10am-3pm at the East End Community Center!  https://www.facebook.com/events/194214551896213/

I support expanding train service for Mainers. As Senator I‚Äôll travel by train to Washington DC and back home. Over-reliance on flying and cars is fueling the climate crisis.  Trains mean less traffic and pollution, and more comfortable and relaxing travel.

Ridiculous: in a Senate race with at least 10 candidates and Ranked Choice Voting, major polling companies are polling Mainers on only 2 of them - even before there's been a primary. We voted for Ranked Choice Voting twice because we're sick of a 2-party system where party bosses pick the nominees for us!

Wow: 81% of Portland voters voted to expand Ranked Choice Voting to city council and school board races! It's clear that once people get to know RCV, they like it. Yet some special interests are scheming to overturn RCV - after Mainers voted for it TWICE.  Here's a better idea: let's pass Ranked Choice Voting nationwide!

The Lisa for Maine team absolutely blew past our ballot drive goal yesterday, with nearly 100 volunteers collecting over 9,000 signatures in a single day. Now we need your help to reach thousands of voters and make history with our campaign for the greater good!

With super volunteer Jess Falero at the East End Community Center, where they've been since 6:30am. Currently at 250 signatures and counting. Thanks to everyone who's working hard today so Mainers can vote for people, planet, and peace this November!
Super morning at the Brunswick polls gathering 50+ signatures an hour for ballot access. So many voters excited to sign to get us on the ballot!

Portland voters: vote Yes on A Tuesday to expand Ranked Choice Voting to all city council & school board races!  Ranked Choice Voting means: ‚úÖ Vote your values without fear ‚úÖ Every vote counts ‚úÖ Winners have majority support ‚úÖ More positive, issue-based campaigns

The Coronavirus outbreak is showing how badly we need Medicare For All. Millions unable to see a doctor, our pandemic response gutted by the GOP's war on science, and Trump's bumbling cover-up of a response all show we can't trust our lives to for-profit healthcare and corporate politicians.
On Super Tuesday we're hoping to get 100 volunteers to the polls to help put our campaign for people, planet, and peace on the ballot. Will you be one of them?

On Super Tuesday we kick off the next phase of our drive to get on the ballot and send a voice for people, planet, and peace to Congress. We‚Äôre hoping to get 100 volunteers out to the polls to collect thousands of signatures. Help us make it happen! https://www.lisaformaine.org/volunteer

Democrats in Congress released a competing plan to the Green New Deal, and it's a total dud. To avoid climate meltdown, we need a ban on fracking and new fossil fuel infrastructure, and a transition to 100% renewable energy by 2030.  Sending a Green voice to the US Senate will send a strong message on climate to all politicians: lead, follow, or get out of the way!

Amnesty International calls the persecution of Julian Assange a "full-scale assault on the right to freedom of expression". Extraditing Assange to the US on espionage charges for exposing war crimes would endanger freedom of the press everywhere. Free Assange!

Young people really get it. They get that climate change is an emergency, our healthcare system is in crisis, student debt is an unjust burden holding them down, and politics has long worked for the powerful, not the people. It's time we listen to them.

Our Green campaign has decided to take an independent route to get on the ballot, because the ballot access barriers enacted by the establishment parties create extreme difficulty for grassroots alternative parties.  We're still Green, and still in it to win it. Thanks to all our supporters for helping us get as far as we have. Read more: https://www.lisaformaine.org/green_campaign_independent_route_to_ballot

A US man who thought he might have coronavirus went to get checked and ended up with a huge bill. Too many Americans would decide they couldn't afford that doctor visit.  Our broken healthcare system is a recipe for a disastrous outbreak. Another reason we need Medicare For All now!

Our children are asking: what part of climate emergency do you not understand? Tackling climate change is the great moral challenge of our time.  Fossil fuels are burning down our home. We need a Green New Deal to convert to an economy where we can thrive!

Chelsea Manning was tortured for blowing the whistle on war crimes. It's outrageous that she's been imprisoned *again* in an authoritarian effort to intimidate truth tellers. We have the right to know what our government does in our name. Free Chelsea Manning!

Medicare For All would save $450 billion and 70,000 lives per year, according to a new Yale study. We can keep the current pay-or-die system that's bankrupting us to enrich big insurance corporations, or we can do what works everywhere else: spend less for better care that covers everyone.

Maine makes it harder for us to get on the ballot than any other campaign. To meet this tough challenge, we need all hands on deck. Wherever you live, you can help. Join our volunteer team and help us build the movement for people, planet, and peace! https://www.lisaformaine.org/volunteer

Over 50 people gave $4,350 to our moneybloom this weekend. Thank you all! Our campaign for people, planet, and peace keeps gaining momentum.  Volunteer now to help us finish our push to get on the ballot and give a million Mainers the chance to vote for the greater good!  https://lisaformaine.org/volunteer

We already had a harder path to get on the ballot than any other campaign. Then they changed the rules and made it even tougher. Help us get our campaign for people, planet, and peace on the ballot! Volunteer from anywhere: https://www.lisaformaine.org/volunteer
Thanks to our MANY moneybloomers, the donations are pouring in! ‚ù§Ô∏è Keep on sharing!!!

Our campaign is inspired by love and the deep desire to build a better world. We want to give everyone the chance to vote for people, planet, and peace in this historic ranked choice vote.  Please help us make it happen - chip in to our ballot fund moneybloom today! üåπüåª‚ù§Ô∏è  https://www.lisaformaine.org/ballotfund

The heart of our campaign is love and a deep desire for a better world. Now we need your help to get on the ballot to give a million Mainers the chance to vote their hearts in this historic ranked choice vote. Show your love for people, planet, and peace by joining in our Valentine's Day moneybloom to get Lisa on the ballot! https://www.lisaformaine.org/lovelisamoneybloom

Ranked choice voting means you're free to vote for what you want, not just the "lesser evil". So if you want: -Medicare For All to replace pay-or-die -An end to student debt to free a generation -An end to endless war -A Green New Deal to ensure human survival Help us get on the ballot & win this race! Thanks to Green Party Co-Founder John Rensenbrink for this wonderful endorsement üíö
Gathering signatures to get on the ballot! Thanks Ayumi & Jess üíöüíö

Our team is working hard to get our grassroots campaign for people, planet & peace on the ballot. 3 ways you can help now: Pledge to sign: https://www.lisaformaine.org/signaturepledge Make calls from anywhere: https://www.lisaformaine.org/make_calls_for_lisa Pitch in to our ballot fund: https://www.lisaformaine.org/ballotfund Help us make history in 2020!

Susan Collins has officially lost the Margaret Chase Smith mantle. Margaret Chase Smith was a profile in courage who defied her own party to speak out against McCarthyism. Susan Collins, with her shameful deference to Donald Trump, has shown herself to be a profile in cowardice.

Thank you CT Greens for  help with our very challenging ballot access petition drive.  The Lisa for Maine team invites you all to come to Maine on the weekend of Feb. 22-23.  Volunteers from all over New England and New York will be helping us collect the 2,300 signatures we need to put a Green in the U.S. Senate race for Susan Collins' seat.

2 days since the Iowa caucus and we're still waiting for results - a good time to reflect on how the US government backed a military coup in Bolivia based on a 23-hour delay in counting election results. We need to stop meddling in other countries and get to work fixing our own democracy.

Susan Collins has stayed in office longer than she said she would, and Mainers no longer want her representing us. In fact, her loyal support for Trump's right-wing agenda has made her the most unpopular Senator in the US. It's time for a change.

The chaotic Iowa Caucus reveals a deeply flawed voting system. To restore trust in our elections, here's what we need nationwide: -Hand-marked paper ballots that voters can verify -A secure paper trail -Risk limiting audits to check results -Accommodations for accessibility -Ranked choice voting -End voter suppression -Make Election Day a holiday

Hooray for the mighty Mainers who collected 75,000+ signatures to stop the CMP Corridor! I signed because I stand with you against this bad deal for Maine and the planet.  Instead of importing energy from Canadian mega-dams, we need a Green New Deal to create clean energy jobs right here at home!
Lisa for Maine team notarizing party in Portland tonight. CT Greens strong üíöüíöüíö driving home tonight!!

My generation owes young people an apology. We Boomers have failed to stop climate crisis, endless war, inequality and injustice.  But more than apologies, our youth need bold action. That's why I'm running - because together we can fix our broken world. Read my op-ed for Bowdoin's student paper and share your thoughts:

We want to give a million voters the chance to vote for a US Senator who proudly stands against endless war, and *for* people, planet, and peace over profit. Our team is braving the cold to get us on the ballot, but to support them we need to reach our goal of $10,000 by Jan 31. Will you pitch in to support our grassroots campaign for the greater good? https://www.lisaformaine.org/ballotfund

Trump's Israel-Palestine plan is an insulting farce. It's not a "deal" if Palestinians weren't involved. Telling people to accept the illegal theft of their land and suppression of their human rights isn't a "peace plan", it's a provocation.  We need peace with justice in Israel-Palestine - and this ain't it.

Medicare For All will save us money. Says who? Everyone who's done an economic study on it. Even conservative and libertarian think tanks found that single-payer healthcare will save enough on bureaucracy to cover the uninsured, upgrade coverage for everyone else, and still cost less than we're paying now.

Great journalism asking every US Senate candidate in Maine if they supported Trump's assassination of Soleimani and why. Susan Collins fully supports Trump. The leading Democrat declined to answer clearly. I strongly oppose this illegal act of war. No war on Iran!

I went on Reddit for an Ask Me Anything last night. Really interesting stuff! We talked about 2020 elections, ranked choice voting, the greatest challenge facing the US, how we appeal to voters across party lines, and more. There's still time to ask questions!

The Doomsday Clock ticking closer to midnight is bad news.  The good news is we have the solutions to turn it back: end the endless wars, lead on global nuclear disarmament, and turn the tide on climate crisis with a Green New Deal. A better world is possible!

Join me on Reddit tonight at 7pm ET and AMA - Ask Me Anything! I'm a Green running for US Senate in Maine against Susan Collins in a ranked choice voting race, and I believe our government should put people, planet, and peace over profit. Please join me - and Ask Me Anything - tonight at 7pm ET: https://www.reddit.com/r/WayOfTheBern/
Excited and grateful that Governor Jesse Ventura is supporting our campaign to elect a Senator who will put people, planet, and peace over party bosses and big donors!

Brazil's far-right regime is targeting US journalist Glenn Greenwald for exposing high-level corruption. Brazil's move follows the blueprint of the US government crackdown on journalists and whistleblowers like Julian Assange, Edward Snowden, Chelsea Manning, John Kiriakou, and more.  We need to stand up for press freedom and the public's right to know what our government is doing!

Doctors say Julian Assange is being tortured and at risk of dying in prison - all for speaking truth to power. Assange's only "crime" was letting people know what the power elite are doing. His persecution is a grave threat to press freedom and democracy itself. Free Assange!

This is big: the 2nd-largest doctors group in the US has come out for Medicare For All, saying the current system costs too much, leaves too many behind, and delivers too little.  It's time we had a healthcare system that will cover everyone, cost less, and won't drive sick people into bankruptcy!

"The problems of racism, economic exploitation, and war are all tied together. These are the triple evils that are interrelated." -Martin Luther King Jr. Like MLK, we need to speak up about the inherent injustice of a system that pits working people against each other, both at home and abroad.

What would MLK say about the fact that over 60% of our federal discretionary budget goes to the military, while millions don't have jobs, healthcare, education, housing, or a safe environment to live in?

Susan Collins has the highest disapproval rating of any senator. That's what happens when you put big donors, party elites, and Donald Trump over the people you're supposed to represent. Mainers deserve a senator who works for the people, not the powerful!

Last year the world's 500 richest people gained $1.2 trillion in wealth. Just think: instead of going into the pockets of people who already have more than they need, that much money could fund a Green New Deal to create jobs for everyone who needs work AND save our planet from climate crisis!

Last year was the second-hottest on record. We just had the hottest decade on record. Scientists who predicted all this warn that Earth is heading for runaway climate meltdown.  We need a Green New Deal now, because there is no Planet B!

2020 is the year we make history! We can change US politics forever, but to make it happen, we need your help. Here's what's new at our campaign to send a champion for people, planet, and peace to be your voice in the US Senate!

source: Lisa Savage for US Senate,Bruce Gagnon
text: New banners are here! Green New Deal                üë∑üèæ        Erase Student Debt üéì Deal with Climate Crisis    üåé       Stop Endless War ‚úåüèº What do you think?

Collins has fallen in lockstep with Trump since day one. We saw that when she helped rush Kavanaugh through without the scrutiny he deserved. She‚Äôs a completely different person from the old Sen. Collins we used to have in Maine. It's time for a change.

I'm a big fan of independent media that covers the really important issues. That's why it was such a pleasure to talk with Graham Elwood about the 2020 election, how ranked choice voting is changing Maine politics, why a Green New Deal would create more and better jobs than military spending, and much more. Give it a listen and let me know what you think!

I worked hard to stop the $45M tax giveaway to General Dynamics that politicians are now having second thoughts about. Bath Iron Works workers are rightly angry about General Dynamics' broken promises to create jobs and improve conditions.  We should invest in a Green New Deal to create more, better jobs at BIW and across Maine - not in corporate welfare for war profiteers.

I proudly stand with everyone who stands against endless war. US military aggression in the Middle East serves war profiteers, not the people. Our friends and neighbors don't want to waste more money and lives on endless war, while Congress fails to solve our problems at home. Call your Senators and tell them to support the War Powers Resolution to prevent President Trump from launching a unilateral attack on Iran!

Maine has long been friendly to independent politics outside the two-party box, and now it's even friendlier thanks to ranked choice voting. Who cares which candidates have party bosses and big money behind them? The media should cover what each campaign offers and let the voters decide. Thanks to Russell Wray for this great letter to the editor!

At this moment when another president is trying to start another war based on suspect intelligence, don't forget that the courageous whistleblower who exposed the criminal Iraq war is still in prison. Chelsea Manning is a political prisoner who's being harshly punished for telling the truth.  In what kind of society are the people who expose war crimes and torture punished, while the war criminals and torturers are never held accountable?

I think I understand pretty well what my neighbors are struggling with and what their lives are like, and I don‚Äôt think they want to go to war with Iraq and Iran. People are tired of endless war while things get worse at home. They need a voice in Congress.

source: Lisa Savage for US Senate,Lisa Savage

text: Every war is profit for arms dealers - the same ones that bankroll congressional campaigns and swarm Congress with lobbyists to ensure they keep voting for endless war.  Let's break this vicious cycle. Congress should work for people, planet, and peace - not war profiteers.

Great to see coverage of Saturday's anti-war rally with quotes from supporters of our campaign. Our voices against endless war are being heard. Thanks to everyone who's speaking out to stop the next war!

Proud to stand this weekend with everyone who came out in the cold and rain to say No War with Iran!  If you're sick of the bipartisan war machine, please support our campaign to put an antiwar voice in the US Senate. I'll work to end the wars and bring the war dollars home for real human needs!

source: Lisa Savage for US Senate,Sam Pfeifle,Lisa Savage Supporters
text: Video of statement at #nowarwithIran demo in Portland, Maine yesterday (thanks, Adam Rice): https://www.facebook.com/anonJaune/videos/2687856597962292/?d=n

I strongly condemn Trump's provocation against Iran. We need a Senator willing to stand up to the president and the Pentagon to say NO to more warmongering. We need elected officials who represent the people, rather than campaign donors who profit off war.

Australia is being devastated by out-of-control wildfires - an alarming vision of the future if we don't act to stop climate crisis.  The costs of a Green New Deal are far lower than the costs of homes, crops, and lives destroyed by raging fires, storms, and floods. Remember: there is no Planet B!
Tireless campaign workers Mary Beth Sullivan and Bruce Gagnon going home with two bags of socks donated for people experiencing homelessness, and an armload of ballot petitions.

source: Lisa Savage for US Senate,Violet Rose Zitola
text: Happy New Year! Time to elect a senator for people, planet & peace to represent Maine. Join the campaign, donate to our ballot access fund, and volunteer at lisaformaine.org.Signing to get Lisa Savage on the ballot.  Our first Green US Senator!!

More than 90 corporations in the Fortune 500 paid $0 in income tax last year. The fact that giant, profitable multinationals are paying less taxes than you & me is directly related to why millions of us are struggling without jobs, healthcare & education.

source: Lisa Savage for US Senate,Kelly F. Merrill
text: Thanks, Kelly F. Merrill, for sharing this great photo of us opposing the CMP corridor.(Lewiston, Maine) Left to Right:  Mark Roman, Lisa Savage, Dawn Neptune Adams, and John Rodriguez gather before entering the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers Dec. 5th public hearing in Lewiston,  to condemn the CMP corridor for being an environmental and human rights' disaster for Mainers.

The US came in #7 on the list of premature deaths from pollution with nearly 200K - right between Bangladesh and Russia.  Pollution takes a massive toll in lives and healthcare costs. That's why a Green New Deal would essentially pay for itself with the health savings alone.

A single blowout at a fracked gas well released more of the super-potent greenhouse gas methane than most European nations do in a year. Fracking is worse than a bridge to nowhere - it's a bridge to hell. We need a Green New Deal for 100% clean energy by 2030!

I'm grateful to have such a great team working on our campaign for the greater good. Bruce Gagnon wrote about why he's taking unpaid leave from his job to help us get on the ballot. People are tired of the political establishment and more are joining us every day!
Merry Christmas, Happy Hanukkah, and happy holidays to all our friends in Maine, across the country, and around the world! Wishing you peace, love, and happiness today and every day üôÇ

You can help our campaign to elect a Senator for people, planet, and peace no matter where you live. We're starting to make calls to get our message to thousands of Maine voters. Volunteer from home or have a phone banking party! Here's how:
Partying with the SF Greens üíö
Hope to see you there!

Join the Lisa for Maine team for a New Year's Eve Party to start 2020 right! Bring new pairs of socks for the Portland homeless community, and wear your favorites for our sock hop. We'll kick off our ballot petition signing at the stroke of midnight. 2020 is the year we make history! For more info and to RSVP: https://www.lisaformaine.org/new_years_eve_party

As ex-VP and chief negotiator for my teacher's union local, I was honored to join our union friends at America's Work Force Radio to talk Maine's ranked-choice-vote Senate race, how big money ruins politics, why working people need Medicare for All, how a Green New Deal will create tons of good union jobs, and more. Give it a listen and let me know what you think!

As a teacher in rural Maine, I work with children whose families are struggling to survive. They need jobs, healthcare, education, and a healthy environment. Congress has failed them.  That's why I'm running for US Senate to build a system that works for all of us. Thanks to ranked choice voting, we have a real chance to win. Help us get our grassroots campaign on the ballot!

Julian Assange is a political prisoner, persecuted for the crime of revealing the corruption & war crimes of powerful people. It's outrageous that the US and UK governments are torturing one of the world's most important journalists to death before our eyes. Free Assange!

I‚Äôm running for US Senate to work for the people, not the powerful. Thanks to ranked choice voting, we have a real chance to win.  We need signatures from 2,000 Maine voters to get our grassroots campaign for people, planet, and peace on the ballot - will you be one of them?

I believe there are legitimate concerns that Trump has abused power, but I‚Äôm concerned that the articles of impeachment in their current narrow formulation do not truly rise to the level of high crimes and misdemeanors that the Constitution lays out as a prerequisite for impeachment. Neither censure nor removal from office will fix the serious threats afflicting our democracy, which are pervasive and fundamentally related to the corruption of our political system.  We urgently need to get big money out of government and get the people back in. Until we elect candidates who will change the system, we will only get more of the same.

Our campaign is uniting progressives, independents, and everyone who wants a government that works for the greater good. Ranked choice voting makes "splitting the vote" impossible. If you want a Senator who puts people, planet, and peace over profit, join us! Thanks to Mary Beth Sullivan for this fantastic letter to the editor!

source: Lisa Savage for US Senate,Independence Media Network
text: I spoke with the Independence Media Network's William Pounds about Maine's 2020 Senate race, Susan Collins, Julian Assange, why working people need Medicare for All, how a Green New Deal could convert weapons factories to building clean energy and public transit, why our campaign is building support from across Maine and across the country, and more!Lisa Savage Joins William Pounds on IMN‚Äôs The Evolution Revolution Podcast to discuss her campaign against Susan Collins and the psychological torture of Julian Assange Donate to Lisa Savage for US Senate to invigorate a pro-Assange Senate campaign: https://www.lisaformaine.org/donate

We've reached our first 1,000 followers! Thank you to each and every one of you who has helped our campaign for people, planet, and peace get this far. Please help us keep building momentum by joining our group Lisa Savage Supporters‚Äã, inviting friends, and continuing to spread the word about our grassroots campaign for the greater good!

I teach in a low-income area, & I've been concerned for years about the well-being of the families in my area. They‚Äôre really struggling to survive. They don‚Äôt have adequate health care or jobs. Washington DC is failing them. They need real change.

Our campaign is now verified on Twitter - hooray! Please follow us @LisaForMaine for the latest on our campaign for people, planet, and peace. Thank you all so much for your support!  https://twitter.com/LisaForMaine

Both Democrats & Republicans voted overwhelmingly for a $738 billion military spending bill - while at the same time they're telling us we don't have money for healthcare, education, housing, or saving our planet. Outrageous. As your voice in the Senate, I'll vote to end the wars and bring those billions home for human needs!

The only Senate campaign at the CMP Corridor/NECEC hearing was ours. The journalists there heard us name all the reasons why NECEC is a bad deal for Maine... then ignored us in their reporting. Democracy requires a press that informs the public. Check out Natasha Mayers' letter holding the press accountable!

Unlike both parties in Congress, I will NOT vote to reauthorize the unconstitutional PATRIOT Act. Handing Trump abusive, authoritarian surveillance powers is the opposite of resistance. We need to end unconstitutional surveillance and unwarranted spying now!

The Afghanistan papers show yet another war the peace movement got right from the beginning. As for the government? "Officials issued rosy pronouncements they knew to be false & hid unmistakable evidence the war had become unwinnable." End the Afghan War now!

I stand with 65% of Mainers who oppose the CMP Corridor. There's nothing green about cutting down our Maine woods, drowning a forest the size of Vermont for a mega-dam, or a shady contract that allows corporations to claim imported fossil fuel energy as "clean". This project means continued cultural genocide of native peoples, and continued destruction of the Earth we depend on for life. To tackle the climate crisis we need a Green New Deal and a local clean energy revolution - not a boondoggle for foreign investors! Thanks to all my fellow speakers for your informative and moving remarks: John Gonzalez of the Pimicikamak Nation Dawn Neptune Adams of the Penobscot Nation Jonathan Carter, Former Maine Green Gubernatorial candidate Dr. Jill Stein, Former Green Presidential candidate Jess Valero, homeless advocate Mark Roman, reading remarks of Barry Dana, Former Chief of the Penobscot Nation

The CMP Corridor is a bad deal for Maine. There's nothing green about drowning 53 miles of trees. Instead of importing energy from Canadian megadams, we need a Green New Deal to create clean renewable energy jobs here at home!

Join me at Thursday's hearing to say NO to the CMP Corridor! Cutting through 53 miles of Maine woods for corporate profits is no way to address climate crisis or protect the resources our economy depends on.  NECEC is a bad deal for Maine. If we want to keep corporate hands off our Maine woods, the time to stand up is now!

We've been busy! In the past few weeks we announced opposition to the CMP Corridor, spoke out against war and McCarthyism, made new hires, started collecting signature pledges for our ballot drive, and much more. Check out our latest news from the trail. Thank you for supporting our campaign for people, planet and peace!

Lots of people share our Green values, but never saw how an independent party could succeed in the US system. Now that Maine has Ranked Choice Voting, we have unprecedented freedom to vote for what we really want. I believe most people want a Green New Deal to fight the climate crisis and make things that people actually need, instead of spending our wealth on weapons that make the world less safe.

I stand with Mainers against the CMP Corridor! Join me, Jill Stein, Penobscot journalist Dawn Neptune Adams and former Maine Green Governor candidate Jonathan Carter at the public hearing in Lewiston this Thursday 12/5 to let everyone know why the CMP Corridor/NECEC is a bad deal for Maine. Keep corporate hands off our Maine woods!  Details at: https://www.lisaformaine.org/no_cmp_corridor_press_conference

Looking forward to Campaign School in Portland on December 7. We need to get more good people in our government!  If you're interested in running for office or helping out on a campaign team, this training is for you. Hope to see you there!

How can we celebrate Thanksgiving in a way that honors Native Americans? To quote Penobscot Tribal Ambassador Maulian Dana: "Do work on the day and every day to fight racism, decolonize your personal and political acts, and actively be inclusive and respectful of Native Nations." Let's work every day to fight racism and promote respect for diversity!

Wow: Scotland produced enough wind energy in the first half of 2019 to power all its homes twice over. Who says we can't get to 100% renewable energy by 2030? All we're missing is the political will for a Green New Deal!

Greenhouse gas levels reached record highs in 2018. Rising seas, hotter temperatures, and more extreme weather make climate crisis the biggest challenge humanity has ever faced.  We need a Green New Deal now to put people to work building a livable future for our children!

Unlike both parties in Congress, I will NOT reauthorize the unconstitutional PATRIOT Act. Shocking that some who call themselves "progressives" are supporting the abusive programs exposed by whistleblower Edward Snowden. We need to end unconstitutional surveillance and unwarranted spying now!

If you're in Maine, I'd love to see you!  This is the official kickoff of our phonebanking effort to identify registered Green Independents who will sign my petition for ballot access during Jan-March 2020. Volunteers will be making calls from many locations starting tonight. Exciting!

The "war on terror" has killed over 800,000 people and cost the US over $6.4 Trillion. For what? Failed states, refugee crises & worse terrorist threats. People ask "how will you pay for a Green New Deal?" We'll start by bringing the war dollars home!

I stand with Mainers against the CMP Corridor. NECEC is a bad deal for Maine. Cutting through 53 miles of Maine woods for corporate profits is no way to address climate crisis or protect the resources our economy depends on.  Keep corporate hands off our Maine woods!

Delighted to announce that David Gibson will be joining our team as Clean Energy Advisor! David is a clean energy pioneer and champion for people, planet and peace. Looking forward to working together for a Green New Deal and a world where we can not only survive, but thrive!

Americans are 25 times more likely to be killed by gun violence than people in other highly-developed nations. We keep seeing horrific mass shootings at schools and other public spaces, yet bought-off politicians have done next to nothing. It's past time to stop this madness. We need a Congress that values human lives over gun lobby bribes. We should enact background checks for gun buyers, ban assault weapons, and close the gun show loophole. We should respect the 2nd Amendment, yet at the same time we urgently need common sense gun control.
Thanks to Kelly F. Merrill and Chris McCabe for organizing this! Yes, there will be pizza ;-> Hope to see you there!

The US detained 70,000 immigrant children in the past year, more than any other country - exposing them to neglect, abuse and lasting trauma. This is a shameful record. We need to stop this, fix our broken immigration system and respect refugees' human rights!

Despite how most US media are framing it, what's going on in Bolivia is clearly a coup against the democratically-elected President Evo Morales. The baseless claims of election fraud are cover for an attack on democracy. US backing for coups in Latin America has been disastrous for the entire continent. We need to stop pushing reckless, destructive regime change, and stand up for peace, democracy and human rights!

Today those of us who speak up about ending US wars are facing a new McCarthyism: smear campaigns and d√©j√† vu Russia-baiting, cries of "Russian asset" or "Putin puppet". Questioning war is taboo - especially when it's such a huge cash cow for military contractors who bankroll political campaigns. It‚Äôs time to send a Senator to Washington with the courage to stand and say ‚Äúno‚Äù to endless, costly, unwinnable wars. I‚Äôll be proud to speak up ‚Äì no matter what they call me.

Congress spends almost 60% of our federal discretionary  budget on weapons and war. Meanwhile, every day 22 veterans commit suicide and over 50,000 sleep on the streets. Endless war isn't just killing people around the world; it's killing US too.

Today marks the ceasefire that ended the imperial war that ushered in the death and destruction of the 20th century. The seeds of industrialized killing and "wars for peace" were sown. The question today is: will we glorify war, or work for peace? The activist Bernarda Shahn once told me that her mother said prior to the outbreak of what would later be known as World War I: "This whole thing is about nothing more than Mosul Oil."  The more things change, the more they stay the same. My grandfather was injured in WWI on the last day before the armistice, taking shrapnel in his leg, then being gassed as he lay wounded. "Don't believe them when they say the next war is a good war," he later told my father. "There is no such thing." My father went to Korea, believing the recruiters who told him it was another "good war" to fight China and Communism. He was profoundly affected by the poverty & suffering he saw in the wake of a war that killed more than 4.5 million people. My dad taught me that wars are a way for the rich to get richer, and the poor to get poorer. Most of the veterans I know don't want to be thanked for their service. They don't want to be used to glorify war on behalf of the corporations that profit from it.  They wish we would give peace a chance. Whether you commemorate Veterans Day or Armistice Day, let's honor those affected by war - today and every day - by refusing to glorify war and working for peace.

70% of US voters are sick of the political establishment. Ranked choice voting gives an outsider campaign like ours a real shot at winning, but we need to go all in. Sign up for updates today and be a part of our grassroots movement to elect a Senator for people, planet & peace!

The bond that passed yesterday will mean almost a quarter billion dollars for transportation infrastructure - what if we built that at Bath Iron Works, instead of war ships?  In case you missed it, here's my recent column on how converting BIW to a Green New Deal manufacturer would create more jobs that are better for our people and planet:

Over a year before the 2020 election, our campaign to elect a Senator for people, planet, and peace has already been getting great press. This amount of fair, issues-focused coverage this early in the election cycle is virtually unprecedented for a Green campaign - a good sign of things to come!

If we stop spending trillions on wars for oil and bring those war dollars home for a Green New Deal, we'll create far more jobs that are far better for people and planet - and we'll make wars for oil obsolete!

I teach in a low-income area, and I've been concerned for years about the well-being of the families in my area. Economically, they‚Äôre really struggling. They don‚Äôt have adequate health care or jobs. Washington DC is failing them. They need real change.

A lot of people haven't quite realized that ranked choice voting means you don't need to worry about "wasting your vote", "splitting the vote", or "spoiling the election". When people say these things, just let them know that ranked choice voting lets you vote for what you want, and if your 1st choice doesn't win, your vote can still count for your 2nd or 3rd choice. What a wonderful upgrade to our democracy!

The Times Record and PPH ran this Maine Beacon story giving me the last word on why working people deserve a living wage. With 1 in 9 U.S. workers in poverty even when working full-time and year-round, and no rise in the federal minimum wage for a decade while CEO salaries are through the roof, raising the minimum wage to $15/hour is long overdue.
Excellent article about the campaign.....

In just the first few weeks we held an awesome kickoff rally, blew past the FEC fundraising threshold, made headlines in major media, and more. We‚Äôve been inspired by this incredible start to our grassroots campaign to elect a Senator who works for the people, not the powerful. Thank you so much for all your support!

Folks to pull the state ballot access requirement off we have to secure more than 2,000 registered Maine Green Independent voters signatures in the middle of winter (Jan 1 - March 15).  That means we have to pre-identify these folks, hire a signature collection coordinator, and get loads of volunteers working across the state.  Your donation to the campaign can help make that happen.  Please go to the web site and make a donation today.... Invite your friends to like this page and help us spread the word!
Built in Bath?
Free and open to the public. Join us!
I think that young people are looking to my generation and saying, ‚ÄòWhat part of emergency do you not understand? Do we have a future on this planet?

We're constantly told that pouring tax money into military spending creates jobs, but did you know that investing in a Green New Deal would create a lot more jobs AND make us safer?  By converting facilities like Bath Iron Works to produce green energy and public transport, we'd create 50% more jobs and tackle our biggest security threat: climate crisis. I wrote in the Times-Record how Maine and BIW can lead the way to a Green New Deal - check it out!

In last night's Democratic debate there wasn't a single question about the climate crisis. Not one! The corporate media giants hosting the debate whitewashed the greatest threat humanity has ever faced. Forget them - it's up to US to fight for a Green New Deal like our lives depend on it!
Channel 6 covered Lisa for Maine Oct 10 announcement of exploratory campaign.

We deserve a government that works for the people, not the powerful. As a teacher and grandmother, I'm exploring a run for US Senate because I want to protect our children's future and create a better life for us all.  Maine's 2020 Senate race will be historic, the highest-profile race yet to use ranked choice voting. We've never had a better opportunity - or a more urgent need - to come together for the greater good! https://www.lisaformaine.org/

Happy Indigenous Peoples Day! I've celebrated Indigenous Peoples Day with the Wabanaki for years and worked with them to make it a state holiday in Maine. Next step: national! We should all learn the true history of our first peoples, and be guided by their wisdom on sustainable living on this planet.

source: Lisa Savage for US Senate,Lisa Savage
text: If you wanted to say happy birthday with a donation to my Lisa For Maine US Senate campaign I would ‚ù§Ô∏è that! No amount too small in a campaign funded by and for the people, planet & peace.
Lisa for Maine 2020 U.S. Senate Campaign Announcement + More!
10/10/19 In it to win it! #LisaforMaine
Great lineup of speakers today at campaign launch event!
We haven't even kicked off the campaign yet and we're already getting great press coverage. Feels like folks are getting excited to take on the political establishment!

I‚Äôm Lisa Savage, teacher, organizer, and grandmother from Solon, Maine, and I‚Äôm exploring a run for US Senate to give Mainers a Senator who will fight for the people, not the powerful. I believe we deserve a government that works for us, not the big banks, weapons manufacturers, fossil fuel giants and corporate lobbyists who are calling the shots in Washington. As your voice in the Senate, I‚Äôll do what it takes to protect our children‚Äôs future and create a better world for all of us. I believe, as residents of the richest country in world history, we all deserve the fundamentals of a secure life, like good union jobs through a Green New Deal that will put millions to work tackling the climate crisis, a Medicare for All healthcare system that will work for everyone and stop driving sick people into bankruptcy, and quality education for all, including free public higher education without student debt. As a teacher in rural Maine, I work with children whose families are struggling to survive in an economy that‚Äôs thrown working people under the bus. To make things worse, we‚Äôre facing a climate crisis that‚Äôs already harming our farms, fisheries and coast. Yet with all the urgent needs we face, Congress is making things worse by giving almost 60% of our federal discretionary budget to the Pentagon for endless, unwinnable wars that are making the world less safe. It‚Äôs time to say no to politics as usual, and join together to fight for a new system that puts people, planet and peace over profit.  We have a historic opportunity in this race now that Maine has adopted Ranked Choice Voting. Our new and improved voting system, which Mainers won through an inspiring grassroots movement, gives everyone the freedom to vote their values, not their fears.  Together we can seize this moment to build a people-powered campaign that will make history. A recent national poll found a staggering 70% of Americans are fed up with our political system that only works for insiders with money and power. All we have to do is let our neighbors know that they have a real choice. We‚Äôve never had a better opportunity - or a more urgent need - to come together for the greater good. I hope you‚Äôll consider supporting my campaign to give Mainers a Senator for the people. Together, we can create a Maine and a nation that works for all of us! https://www.lisaformaine.org/

More than 90 corporations in the Fortune 500 paid $0 in income tax last year. The fact that giant, profitable multinationals are paying less taxes than you & me is directly related to why millions of us are struggling without jobs, healthcare & education.

source: Lisa Savage for US Senate,Kelly F. Merrill
text: Thanks, Kelly F. Merrill, for sharing this great photo of us opposing the CMP corridor.(Lewiston, Maine) Left to Right:  Mark Roman, Lisa Savage, Dawn Neptune Adams, and John Rodriguez gather before entering the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers Dec. 5th public hearing in Lewiston,  to condemn the CMP corridor for being an environmental and human rights' disaster for Mainers.

The US came in #7 on the list of premature deaths from pollution with nearly 200K - right between Bangladesh and Russia.  Pollution takes a massive toll in lives and healthcare costs. That's why a Green New Deal would essentially pay for itself with the health savings alone.

A single blowout at a fracked gas well released more of the super-potent greenhouse gas methane than most European nations do in a year. Fracking is worse than a bridge to nowhere - it's a bridge to hell. We need a Green New Deal for 100% clean energy by 2030!

I'm grateful to have such a great team working on our campaign for the greater good. Bruce Gagnon wrote about why he's taking unpaid leave from his job to help us get on the ballot. People are tired of the political establishment and more are joining us every day!
Merry Christmas, Happy Hanukkah, and happy holidays to all our friends in Maine, across the country, and around the world! Wishing you peace, love, and happiness today and every day üôÇ

You can help our campaign to elect a Senator for people, planet, and peace no matter where you live. We're starting to make calls to get our message to thousands of Maine voters. Volunteer from home or have a phone banking party! Here's how:
Partying with the SF Greens üíö
Hope to see you there!

Join the Lisa for Maine team for a New Year's Eve Party to start 2020 right! Bring new pairs of socks for the Portland homeless community, and wear your favorites for our sock hop. We'll kick off our ballot petition signing at the stroke of midnight. 2020 is the year we make history! For more info and to RSVP: https://www.lisaformaine.org/new_years_eve_party

As ex-VP and chief negotiator for my teacher's union local, I was honored to join our union friends at America's Work Force Radio to talk Maine's ranked-choice-vote Senate race, how big money ruins politics, why working people need Medicare for All, how a Green New Deal will create tons of good union jobs, and more. Give it a listen and let me know what you think!

As a teacher in rural Maine, I work with children whose families are struggling to survive. They need jobs, healthcare, education, and a healthy environment. Congress has failed them.  That's why I'm running for US Senate to build a system that works for all of us. Thanks to ranked choice voting, we have a real chance to win. Help us get our grassroots campaign on the ballot!

Julian Assange is a political prisoner, persecuted for the crime of revealing the corruption & war crimes of powerful people. It's outrageous that the US and UK governments are torturing one of the world's most important journalists to death before our eyes. Free Assange!

I‚Äôm running for US Senate to work for the people, not the powerful. Thanks to ranked choice voting, we have a real chance to win.  We need signatures from 2,000 Maine voters to get our grassroots campaign for people, planet, and peace on the ballot - will you be one of them?

I believe there are legitimate concerns that Trump has abused power, but I‚Äôm concerned that the articles of impeachment in their current narrow formulation do not truly rise to the level of high crimes and misdemeanors that the Constitution lays out as a prerequisite for impeachment. Neither censure nor removal from office will fix the serious threats afflicting our democracy, which are pervasive and fundamentally related to the corruption of our political system.  We urgently need to get big money out of government and get the people back in. Until we elect candidates who will change the system, we will only get more of the same.

Our campaign is uniting progressives, independents, and everyone who wants a government that works for the greater good. Ranked choice voting makes "splitting the vote" impossible. If you want a Senator who puts people, planet, and peace over profit, join us! Thanks to Mary Beth Sullivan for this fantastic letter to the editor!

source: Lisa Savage for US Senate,Independence Media Network
text: I spoke with the Independence Media Network's William Pounds about Maine's 2020 Senate race, Susan Collins, Julian Assange, why working people need Medicare for All, how a Green New Deal could convert weapons factories to building clean energy and public transit, why our campaign is building support from across Maine and across the country, and more!Lisa Savage Joins William Pounds on IMN‚Äôs The Evolution Revolution Podcast to discuss her campaign against Susan Collins and the psychological torture of Julian Assange Donate to Lisa Savage for US Senate to invigorate a pro-Assange Senate campaign: https://www.lisaformaine.org/donate

I teach in a low-income area, & I've been concerned for years about the well-being of the families in my area. They‚Äôre really struggling to survive. They don‚Äôt have adequate health care or jobs. Washington DC is failing them. They need real change.

Our campaign is now verified on Twitter - hooray! Please follow us @LisaForMaine for the latest on our campaign for people, planet, and peace. Thank you all so much for your support!  https://twitter.com/LisaForMaine

Both Democrats & Republicans voted overwhelmingly for a $738 billion military spending bill - while at the same time they're telling us we don't have money for healthcare, education, housing, or saving our planet. Outrageous. As your voice in the Senate, I'll vote to end the wars and bring those billions home for human needs!

The only Senate campaign at the CMP Corridor/NECEC hearing was ours. The journalists there heard us name all the reasons why NECEC is a bad deal for Maine... then ignored us in their reporting. Democracy requires a press that informs the public. Check out Natasha Mayers' letter holding the press accountable!

Unlike both parties in Congress, I will NOT vote to reauthorize the unconstitutional PATRIOT Act. Handing Trump abusive, authoritarian surveillance powers is the opposite of resistance. We need to end unconstitutional surveillance and unwarranted spying now!

The Afghanistan papers show yet another war the peace movement got right from the beginning. As for the government? "Officials issued rosy pronouncements they knew to be false & hid unmistakable evidence the war had become unwinnable." End the Afghan War now!

I stand with 65% of Mainers who oppose the CMP Corridor. There's nothing green about cutting down our Maine woods, drowning a forest the size of Vermont for a mega-dam, or a shady contract that allows corporations to claim imported fossil fuel energy as "clean". This project means continued cultural genocide of native peoples, and continued destruction of the Earth we depend on for life. To tackle the climate crisis we need a Green New Deal and a local clean energy revolution - not a boondoggle for foreign investors! Thanks to all my fellow speakers for your informative and moving remarks: John Gonzalez of the Pimicikamak Nation Dawn Neptune Adams of the Penobscot Nation Jonathan Carter, Former Maine Green Gubernatorial candidate Dr. Jill Stein, Former Green Presidential candidate Jess Valero, homeless advocate Mark Roman, reading remarks of Barry Dana, Former Chief of the Penobscot Nation

The CMP Corridor is a bad deal for Maine. There's nothing green about drowning 53 miles of trees. Instead of importing energy from Canadian megadams, we need a Green New Deal to create clean renewable energy jobs here at home!

Join me at Thursday's hearing to say NO to the CMP Corridor! Cutting through 53 miles of Maine woods for corporate profits is no way to address climate crisis or protect the resources our economy depends on.  NECEC is a bad deal for Maine. If we want to keep corporate hands off our Maine woods, the time to stand up is now!

We've been busy! In the past few weeks we announced opposition to the CMP Corridor, spoke out against war and McCarthyism, made new hires, started collecting signature pledges for our ballot drive, and much more. Check out our latest news from the trail. Thank you for supporting our campaign for people, planet and peace!

Lots of people share our Green values, but never saw how an independent party could succeed in the US system. Now that Maine has Ranked Choice Voting, we have unprecedented freedom to vote for what we really want. I believe most people want a Green New Deal to fight the climate crisis and make things that people actually need, instead of spending our wealth on weapons that make the world less safe.

I stand with Mainers against the CMP Corridor! Join me, Jill Stein, Penobscot journalist Dawn Neptune Adams and former Maine Green Governor candidate Jonathan Carter at the public hearing in Lewiston this Thursday 12/5 to let everyone know why the CMP Corridor/NECEC is a bad deal for Maine. Keep corporate hands off our Maine woods!  Details at: https://www.lisaformaine.org/no_cmp_corridor_press_conference

Looking forward to Campaign School in Portland on December 7. We need to get more good people in our government!  If you're interested in running for office or helping out on a campaign team, this training is for you. Hope to see you there!

How can we celebrate Thanksgiving in a way that honors Native Americans? To quote Penobscot Tribal Ambassador Maulian Dana: "Do work on the day and every day to fight racism, decolonize your personal and political acts, and actively be inclusive and respectful of Native Nations." Let's work every day to fight racism and promote respect for diversity!

Wow: Scotland produced enough wind energy in the first half of 2019 to power all its homes twice over. Who says we can't get to 100% renewable energy by 2030? All we're missing is the political will for a Green New Deal!

Greenhouse gas levels reached record highs in 2018. Rising seas, hotter temperatures, and more extreme weather make climate crisis the biggest challenge humanity has ever faced.  We need a Green New Deal now to put people to work building a livable future for our children!

Unlike both parties in Congress, I will NOT reauthorize the unconstitutional PATRIOT Act. Shocking that some who call themselves "progressives" are supporting the abusive programs exposed by whistleblower Edward Snowden. We need to end unconstitutional surveillance and unwarranted spying now!

If you're in Maine, I'd love to see you!  This is the official kickoff of our phonebanking effort to identify registered Green Independents who will sign my petition for ballot access during Jan-March 2020. Volunteers will be making calls from many locations starting tonight. Exciting!

The "war on terror" has killed over 800,000 people and cost the US over $6.4 Trillion. For what? Failed states, refugee crises & worse terrorist threats. People ask "how will you pay for a Green New Deal?" We'll start by bringing the war dollars home!

I stand with Mainers against the CMP Corridor. NECEC is a bad deal for Maine. Cutting through 53 miles of Maine woods for corporate profits is no way to address climate crisis or protect the resources our economy depends on.  Keep corporate hands off our Maine woods!

Delighted to announce that David Gibson will be joining our team as Clean Energy Advisor! David is a clean energy pioneer and champion for people, planet and peace. Looking forward to working together for a Green New Deal and a world where we can not only survive, but thrive!
Thanks to Kelly F. Merrill and Chris McCabe for organizing this! Yes, there will be pizza ;-> Hope to see you there!

Despite how most US media are framing it, what's going on in Bolivia is clearly a coup against the democratically-elected President Evo Morales. The baseless claims of election fraud are cover for an attack on democracy. US backing for coups in Latin America has been disastrous for the entire continent. We need to stop pushing reckless, destructive regime change, and stand up for peace, democracy and human rights!

Today those of us who speak up about ending US wars are facing a new McCarthyism: smear campaigns and d√©j√† vu Russia-baiting, cries of "Russian asset" or "Putin puppet". Questioning war is taboo - especially when it's such a huge cash cow for military contractors who bankroll political campaigns. It‚Äôs time to send a Senator to Washington with the courage to stand and say ‚Äúno‚Äù to endless, costly, unwinnable wars. I‚Äôll be proud to speak up ‚Äì no matter what they call me.

Congress spends almost 60% of our federal discretionary  budget on weapons and war. Meanwhile, every day 22 veterans commit suicide and over 50,000 sleep on the streets. Endless war isn't just killing people around the world; it's killing US too.

Today marks the ceasefire that ended the imperial war that ushered in the death and destruction of the 20th century. The seeds of industrialized killing and "wars for peace" were sown. The question today is: will we glorify war, or work for peace? The activist Bernarda Shahn once told me that her mother said prior to the outbreak of what would later be known as World War I: "This whole thing is about nothing more than Mosul Oil."  The more things change, the more they stay the same. My grandfather was injured in WWI on the last day before the armistice, taking shrapnel in his leg, then being gassed as he lay wounded. "Don't believe them when they say the next war is a good war," he later told my father. "There is no such thing." My father went to Korea, believing the recruiters who told him it was another "good war" to fight China and Communism. He was profoundly affected by the poverty & suffering he saw in the wake of a war that killed more than 4.5 million people. My dad taught me that wars are a way for the rich to get richer, and the poor to get poorer. Most of the veterans I know don't want to be thanked for their service. They don't want to be used to glorify war on behalf of the corporations that profit from it.  They wish we would give peace a chance. Whether you commemorate Veterans Day or Armistice Day, let's honor those affected by war - today and every day - by refusing to glorify war and working for peace.
